faculty.name: Ahmad Hassan
faculty.specialization: Educational leadership and Islamic curriculum development
faculty.bio: Principal Ahmad Hassan brings over 15 years of experience in Islamic education to OIA Academy. He holds a Master's degree in Educational Leadership and has dedicated his career to developing comprehensive Islamic educational programs that prepare students for success in both this world and the hereafter.

faculty.name: Abdullah Rahman
faculty.experience: 20 years in Islamic education and community leadership
faculty.specialization: Quranic studies, Islamic jurisprudence, and spiritual guidance
faculty.bio: Imam Abdullah Rahman is a graduate of Al-Azhar University with over 20 years of experience in Islamic education and community leadership. He leads our Islamic studies program and provides spiritual guidance to students, families, and the broader community.

faculty.name: Sarah Al-Zahra
faculty.specialization: Early childhood development and integrated Islamic learning
faculty.bio: Sarah Al-Zahra specializes in elementary education with a focus on integrating Islamic values into every aspect of learning. Her nurturing approach helps young students develop a strong foundation in both academic subjects and Islamic character.

faculty.name: Omar Khalil
faculty.experience: 12 years in mathematics and science education
faculty.specialization: STEM education and Islamic perspectives on scientific inquiry
faculty.bio: Omar Khalil brings a unique perspective to science and mathematics education, demonstrating how scientific inquiry and Islamic principles work together harmoniously. His innovative teaching methods make complex concepts accessible to all students.

faculty.name: Fatima Noor
faculty.specialization: Arabic language acquisition and Islamic literature
faculty.bio: Fatima Noor is passionate about preserving and teaching the Arabic language. Her comprehensive approach includes classical Arabic literature, modern communication skills, and the beautiful art of Islamic calligraphy.

faculty.name: Aisha Mohamed
faculty.specialization: Student mental health and Islamic counseling approaches
faculty.bio: Aisha Mohamed provides comprehensive counseling services to our students, incorporating Islamic principles of mental health and well-being. She supports students through academic challenges, personal growth, and spiritual development.

departments.name: Islamic Studies
departments.description: Quranic studies, Islamic history, and spiritual guidance
